data.title: [2.1] Enhance TextureButton and TextureFrame with resize
data.body:
* Add stretch mode `STRETCH_KEEP_ASPECT_COVERED` like CSS `background-size: cover`.
* Make same resize behavior for TextureButton with TextureFrame
* ~~~Remove property 'scale' of TextureButton which is not required any more.~~~
* Add option ResizeMode for backwards compatibility

data.title: Random crashing on Arch Linux: xcb
data.body:
Forenote: this issue was not encountered initially (with low usage, mind you), so might be caused by being on a rolling system, or it might be something done by Godot in an unstable/depreciated way.

OS: Arch Linux, most up-to-date system as of today (Feb 3, 2017).
libxcb 1.12-1 is what I have and the relevant library AFAICT
nVidia driver version 375.26 (graphics card is a GTX 1050 Ti)

Godot version: 2.1.2 stable
AUR version, 64-bit download, 32-bit download, Steam version.

Any project. Tried with multiple projects, sometimes they work and sometimes not.

Error:
[xcb] Unknown request in queue while dequeuing
[xcb] Most likely this is a multi-threaded client and XInitThreads has not been called
[xcb] Aborting, sorry about that.
godot: xcb_io.c:165: dequeue_pending_request: Assertion `!xcb_xlib_unknown_req_in_deq' failed.

The result is commonly it successfully getting to the project manager, and crashing upon editing a project. Sometimes it will successfully open the project, and sometimes it will simply freeze (just the app, not my system). I've only had it happen once, but it has crashed before even reaching the project manager before.

______________________________________

Other notes:

When opening a project, 2 Godot splash screens appear (with the titlebar on the top full width), this happens in all cases.

Some of the example projects in steam crash mid-run with the same error (godot.x11.opt.tools.64: xcb_io.c:165: dequeue_pending_request: Assertion `!xcb_xlib_unknown_req_in_deq' failed). Happens in:

-  Window Management. Simply move the window or hit any of the built-in window controls.
-  GUI in 3D. Happens after a while (when using the spinbox?), the window will force mouse focus randomly and the mouse will disappear, tabbing out/between windows will eventually cause it.
- this also appeared when trying to run one of the sample projects (after having the xcb error with a different project) and having it crash immediately (not sure if relevant):

X Error of failed request:  BadRequest (invalid request code or no such operation)
  Major opcode of failed request:  0 ()
  Serial number of failed request:  219
  Current serial number in output stream:  219
X Error of failed request:  BadRequest (invalid request code or no such operation)
  Major opcode of failed request:  0 ()
  Serial number of failed request:  220
  Current serial number in output stream:  220

EDIT: Result of 'strace -e open,stat godot' : http://pastebin.com/dw86ZicG
EDIT2: Ran it again, the end is a little different:

godot: xcb_io.c:630: _XReply: Assertion `!xcb_xlib_threads_sequence_lost' failed.
--- SIGCHLD {si_signo=SIGCHLD, si_code=CLD_KILLED, si_pid=27580, si_uid=1000, si_status=SIGABRT, si_utime=14, si_stime=51} ---
open("/proc/sys/vm/overcommit_memory", O_RDONLY|O_CLOEXEC) = 3
+++ exited with 0 +++

data.title: Selected text is now deselected on ctrl+home/end
data.body: This fixes Issue #7694 and also the error mentioned in the comments of that issue. When text is selected and we hit Ctrl+Home/End the text will be deselected. When we hit Ctrl+Shift+Home all text from the current column to the first column at the top of the editor will be selected.

This is a simple but very useful node and it could be in the 2.1.x releases.

*PS: The original commit has other changes but I think they are not related to ColorFrame.*

data.title: V2.1.2 Ternary crashes exported exe
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 7 (x64) desktop
Godot v2.1.2

**Issue description:**
The use of the ternary operator causes the exported .exe to crashes. The applications runs perfectly fine when in editor but not when exported. 
The export debug reports the following error:

> SCRIPT ERROR: GDScript::load_byte_code: Parse Error: Expected end of statement (var)
> At: res://TernaryTest.gdc :6
> Error: GDScript::load_byte_code: Method/Function Failed, returning: ERR_PARSE_ERROR
> At: modules\gdscript\gd_script.cpp:720


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Use the ternary operator in your code i.e. var frame = 0 if (!challenge.unlocked) else 1
2. Export project
3. Run exported project

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Test project](https://github.com/gonzo191/GodotTernaryTest)

data.title: Question: Hiding/disabling the built-in script editor?
data.body:
Is there a good way to completely disable the built-in script editor? Selecting an external editor in the settings doesn't change its behaviour.

It feels very intrusive when you don't want to use it. It pops up every time there's an error message, slowing down the workflow every time you have to switch back to the viewport you were working in. I'm not knocking the script editor, it's probably fine, but I prefer my vim setup the way it is.

I'd be happy to submit the change as a pull request, if there's currently no way to disable it.

data.title: Fix compile error
building godot fails on ssl include problems
data.body:
Building godot from source stops with an error, both with llvm or gcc-6.3 (which is not supported anyway). The errors seem to be with libssl includes for BIO.

debian SID 64-bit.
libssl-dev:amd64                                                          1.1.0d-2

```
~/godot (2.1.2-stable)$ g++ --version
g++ (Debian 6.3.0-3) 6.3.0 20170118
Copyright (C) 2016 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

~/godot (2.1.2-stable)$ clang --version
clang version 3.8.1-17 (tags/RELEASE_381/final)
Target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
Thread model: posix
InstalledDir: /usr/bin
```

To reproduce:
```
~/godot (2.1.2-stable)$ git status
On branch 2.1.2-stable
nothing to commit, working tree clean
:~/godot (2.1.2-stable)$ scons platform=x11 use_llvm=yes
...

~/godot (2.1.2-stable)$ clang++ -o modules/openssl/stream_peer_openssl.x11.tools.64.llvm.o -c -g2 -Wall -DDEBUG_ENABLED -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC -DSCI_NAMESPACE -DENABLE_DEPRECATED -DTYPED_METHOD_BIND -DOPENGL_ENABLED -DALSA_ENABLED -DJOYDEV_ENABLED -DPULSEAUDIO_ENABLED -DX11_ENABLED -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLES_OVER_GL -DTOOLS_ENABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -DGLEW_STATIC -DGLEW_ENABLED -DMODULE_SPEEX_ENABLED -DMODULE_GRIDMAP_ENABLED -DMODULE_DDS_ENABLED -DMODULE_VORBIS_ENABLED -DMODULE_CHIBI_ENABLED -DMODULE_OGG_ENABLED -DMODULE_OPUS_ENABLED -DMODULE_PVR_ENABLED -DMODULE_IK_ENABLED -DMODULE_GDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMODULE_ENET_ENABLED -DMODULE_MPC_ENABLED -DMODULE_REGEX_ENABLED -DMODULE_JPG_ENABLED -DMODULE_VISUAL_SCRIPT_ENABLED -DMODULE_THEORA_ENABLED -DMODULE_ETC1_ENABLED -DMODULE_SQUISH_ENABLED -DMODULE_OPENSSL_ENABLED -D_REENTRANT -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/x11 -I/usr/include/freetype2 -I/usr/include/libpng16 -I/usr/include/alsa -Ithirdparty/glew modules/openssl/stream_peer_openssl.cpp
modules/openssl/stream_peer_openssl.cpp:64:29: warning: 'ASN1_STRING_data' is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
        common_name_str = (char *) ASN1_STRING_data(common_name_asn1);
                                   ^
/usr/include/openssl/asn1.h:553:35: note: 'ASN1_STRING_data' has been explicitly marked deprecated here
DEPRECATEDIN_1_1_0(unsigned char *ASN1_STRING_data(ASN1_STRING *x))
                                  ^
modules/openssl/stream_peer_openssl.cpp:105:30: warning: 'ASN1_STRING_data' is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
                        char *dns_name = (char *) ASN1_STRING_data(current_name->d.dNSName);
                                                  ^
/usr/include/openssl/asn1.h:553:35: note: 'ASN1_STRING_data' has been explicitly marked deprecated here
DEPRECATEDIN_1_1_0(unsigned char *ASN1_STRING_data(ASN1_STRING *x))
                                  ^
modules/openssl/stream_peer_openssl.cpp:176:3: error: member access into incomplete type 'BIO' (aka 'bio_st')
        b->init = 1;

```
...

data.title: Parallelize rigid body islands resolution
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2 - 3.0

**Issue description:**
![parallelizable_code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5478365/22528782/a7d5757e-e8cc-11e6-8b44-7ab7436f6f56.png)
In this loop each iteration is indipended from each other. I think this is a good opportunity to parallelize the physics engine. We could have a number of worker threads (tunable by the user thorugh a project property or through a new method of the PhysicsServer interface) and dispatch the islands to the different threads trying to balance the number of constraints each worker thread will process.

This should give a big speed up for cases when we have many ragdolls, as the task of solving multiple ragdolls can be spread among different cores/hw threads.

data.title: Collision with edges between convex/planar face pair
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2 - 3.0

**Issue description:**
When a rigid body collides with a polygonal shape, edges that are between two faces forming a convex shape are not ignored but a collision with the edge is practically impossible. This causes a weird effect because if a rigid body momentarely penetrate the shape near the joining edge the body is unrealistically pushed on one side of the edge.

![edges_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5478365/22527320/9ec5d7fe-e8c6-11e6-9061-b2e70dd9b39d.png)
(Sorry my graphics tablet isn't working anymore, so I just used to mouse)

As you can see in image A the object hitting the flat plane made of two faces is pushed by the edge.
In image B I've drawn an edge and two faces. The edge is perpendicular to the screen. Now to understand that an edge has to be ignored we can look at the normals of the faces separated by the edge. If we compute the angle and this is greater or equal to 180 degrees then we ignore the edge.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a  static body with a planar collision shape made of two faces, on the plan xz and put a spherical rigid body on top of the egde slighty off one side.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[edge_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/746290/edge_bug.zip)

data.title: Expose collision resolution bias in editor for rigid bodies/collision shapes
data.body: It would be very useful to extend the PhysicsServer interface and rigid bodies to expose a custom bias for collision resolution and add a global property with the default bias factor for the project. In fact I had to change it in the PhysicsServerSW implementation to have small bodies not to sink inside polygonal collision shapes.

data.title: Godot usage of dedicated/integrated graphic cards
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.12

**Issue description:**
By default, unless i [enforce Intel vcar](http://i.imgur.com/3rVy7Vg.png), godot uses nvidia graphic card(even though Intel is default)
As i'm unaware of mechanics behind how card is chosen, i admit it might be not a direct issue of godot.

Still in all my cases when system considers intel card as default all applications uses it as default.
But it is not a case with godot, which raises a question why?

For now i specified godot editor to use only Intel to avoid unnecessary usage of my nvidia chip

data.title: DVector<unsigned char>::resize - mem.is_locked() is true
data.body:
Windows 8
Godot 2.1.1-stable & Godot 2.1.2-stable

Running the game gives following error
![godot_mem_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6707330/22502069/b30faf38-e86b-11e6-9944-0d6939f15809.png)

Sometimes after a few minutes, sometimes after an hour.

I am not really sure how to reproduce this, as it seems pretty random when it occurs. I can also confirm that this isn't happening on Ubuntu 16.04 as it is my daily OS.

Some quotes from IRC that might be helpfull (thanks to kitkat_):

> <kitkat_> multithreading shenanigans
> <kitkat_> SSE2 maybe? (since windows 8 needs SSE2)

> <kitkat_> godot\core\dvector.h line 365
> <kitkat_> It means the program is trying to resize the vector while another thread has locked it

data.title: Ctrl-Home / Ctrl-End does not deselect text selection in editor
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.1.2 branch custom build

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When you select text in any text editor (ex. Notepad / Sublime Text) and hit Ctrl-End the cursor will go to the last position in the text file and any text that was selected will be deselected. Godot's editor however does not deselect the selected text.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Select text in Godot GDScript editor.
- Hit Ctrl-End or Ctrl-Home
- Notice that the text is still selected

data.title: Collision shapes persist after they've been deleted
data.body:
OS: Linux Mint 18
Godot: 2.1.2

Steps to reproduce:
Create a scene consisting of a KinematicBody with a child CollisionShape (I used capsule). Add some sort of image or animation as well, so the object is visible (I used AnimatedSprite3D). Script the KinematicBody so that it has downward movement (I used the move() function with a downward Y direction)
Save the scene and place an instance of the scene in a scene with a collide-able floor.
Test the game and verify that the object stops at the floor.
Then, delete the CollisionShape from the saved scene.
When you run the test again, you should see the object still continuing to collide with the ground.

Originally I thought this was just my lack of understanding of how Godot collision works, but you can verify that it's a bug by following the above steps again, but never create the CollisionShape in the first place. The object will pass through the floor as expected.

data.title: Z-index for the Button node? Or... all Control Nodes?
data.body:
Why is there no z-index for the Button node, Panel node and I believe all Control Nodes?

When I press on the button in my game, a panel should be sliding from out of camera view into the camera view. The panel should be beneath the button on Z-Index. But instead it overlaps the button.

But for some reason it doesn't has Z-index option. And from the other controls I've seen, none actually do... is there a particle reason for it?

I'm using Godot 2.1.2 Stable.

![selection_075](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12195202/22479943/ab8b20ca-e7bd-11e6-9dd0-8257905d32d9.png)

There is also issues with my ice cream truck (the brown area around the wheels). It shows up on the back wheels and slightly on the front (the brown area is not supposed to be there at all, at least visually). Triangulating the mesh pre-export in Blender helps but does not solve the issue.

**Steps to reproduce:**

data.title: Poor optimizations in the physics engine
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 25 (Linux)

**Issue description:**
Collision shapes on even simple meshes can cause serious performance hits on the smallest collisions. Here is a video of a car of mine colliding with my roads, which collision shape seems to be that of a cube, at the least a very simple mesh

It is common also for after the performance hit for the mesh to seemingly teleport elsewhere and collide right though objects.
![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12195202/22479710/c46eafcc-e7bc-11e6-8bdb-288b3e15a87c.gif)


**Steps to reproduce:**
I can create a simple scene (using non default objects like the cube), say a car and a much simpler map, and I will get similar behavior

data.title: Enable WebGL2 in web export, start fixing build
data.body:
Will not yet compile, unless removing:
 - `#include "audio_server_javascript.h"` from `os_javascript.h`
 - `"audio_server_javascript.cpp",` from `SCsub`
 - `env.Append(CPPFLAGS=['-DGLES_NO_CLIENT_ARRAYS'])` from `detect.py`

Will not actually run either way.

To do:
 - update WebAudio server
 - update `GLES_NO_CLIENT_ARRAYS` code
 - adjust for [WebGL2 differences](https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/latest/2.0/#5)

data.title: iOS build: Reached end of file while looking for: uint32_t
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mac 10.11.6,  Xcode 8.2.1, Godot 2.1.2 (official), Godot 2.1.1(official)

**Issue description:**
Try to build for iOS (success) and run on device:
"XCode error : Reached end of file while looking for: uint32_t"

To correct this bug (or features):
Rename "Godot_v2.1.2-stable_export_templates.tpz" -> "Godot_v2.1.2-stable_export_templates.zip"
Unpack "GodotiOSXCode.zip"
Go to upacked folder "godot_ios_xcode"
Copy file "godot_ios_xcode/godot_opt.iphone" to folder "godot_ios_xcode/godot_xcode" and replace "godot_opt.iphone" (with 0 size)
And copy your "data.pck" file in the same folder to replace "data.pck" (with 0 size)

Then try build and then run build.
All done

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:
